detaileddescription.para: Clear a scalar to prevent the leak of sensitive data.

memberdef.argsstring: (const secp256k1_scalar *a, unsigned int offset, unsigned int count)
memberdef.name: secp256k1_scalar_get_bits_limb32

detaileddescription.para: Access bits (1 < count <= 32) from a scalar. All requested bits must belong to the same 32-bit limb.

memberdef.argsstring: (const secp256k1_scalar *a, unsigned int offset, unsigned int count)
memberdef.name: secp256k1_scalar_get_bits_var

detaileddescription.para: Access bits (1 < count <= 32) from a scalar. offset + count must be < 256. Not constant time in offset and count.

Set a scalar from a big endian byte array. The scalar will be reduced modulo group order n. In: bin: pointer to a 32-byte array. Out: r: scalar to be set. overflow: non-zero if the scalar was bigger or equal to n before reduction, zero otherwise (can be NULL).
Set a scalar from a big endian byte array and returns 1 if it is a valid seckey and 0 otherwise.
Set a scalar to an unsigned integer.
Convert a scalar to a byte array.
Add two scalars together (modulo the group order). Returns whether it overflowed.
Conditionally add a power of two to a scalar. The result is not allowed to overflow.
Multiply two scalars (modulo the group order).
Compute the inverse of a scalar (modulo the group order).
Compute the inverse of a scalar (modulo the group order), without constant-time guarantee.
Compute the complement of a scalar (modulo the group order).
Multiply a scalar with the multiplicative inverse of 2.
Check whether a scalar equals zero.
Check whether a scalar equals one.
Check whether a scalar, considered as an nonnegative integer, is even.
Check whether a scalar is higher than the group order divided by 2.
Conditionally negate a number, in constant time. Returns -1 if the number was negated, 1 otherwise
Compare two scalars.
Find r1 and r2 such that r1+r2*2^128 = k.

memberdef.argsstring: (secp256k1_scalar *SECP256K1_RESTRICT r1, secp256k1_scalar *SECP256K1_RESTRICT r2, const secp256k1_scalar *SECP256K1_RESTRICT k)
memberdef.name: secp256k1_scalar_split_lambda

detaileddescription.para: Find r1 and r2 such that r1+r2*lambda = k, where r1 and r2 or their negations are maximum 128 bits long (see secp256k1_ge_mul_lambda). It is required that r1, r2, and k all point to different objects.

memberdef.argsstring: (secp256k1_scalar *r, const secp256k1_scalar *a, const secp256k1_scalar *b, unsigned int shift)
memberdef.name: secp256k1_scalar_mul_shift_var

detaileddescription.para: Multiply a and b (without taking the modulus!), divide by 2**shift, and round to the nearest integer. Shift must be at least 256.
If flag is true, set *r equal to *a; otherwise leave it. Constant-time. Both *r and *a must be initialized.
Check invariants on a scalar (no-op unless VERIFY is enabled).
